definition: Group 17 elements that are highly reactive nonmetals forming salts with metals

positive_examples: The swimming pool was treated with chlorine to kill bacteria
Fluoride toothpaste helps prevent tooth decay
Bromine is extracted from seawater for industrial use
Iodine solution was applied to disinfect the wound
Table salt contains sodium and chlorine atoms
Fluorine compounds are used in refrigeration systems
negative_examples: Oxygen gas is essential for breathing
Nitrogen makes up most of the atmosphere
Carbon forms the basis of organic compounds
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NobleGases, AlkaliMetals, TransitionMetals, Metalloids

opposite_reasoning: NobleGases provides the strongest semantic opposition to Halogens based on fundamental chemical properties: maximum reactivity vs maximum inertness. Both are element groups at the same taxonomic level (periodic table groups), making them perfectly comparable while being behaviorally opposite. This creates an ideal axis for Fisher-LDA where the concepts are maximally separated in chemical property space. While the AI safety steering utility is moderate (chemistry concepts have limited deception-detection relevance), the opposition strength is exceptional for the concept space, and Noble Gases likely exists in both WordNet and SUMO.
